result.execSummary:
The defendant Gilbert Barrientez III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Stalking - Prev Conviction w/in 7 Yrs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.32(2m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.
Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided. Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).  Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Probation maybe transfered to another state. Any assessments, counseling or  treatment as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gilbert Barrientez III
